Module lanat
Package lanat.parsing.errors

Class ErrorFormatter

java.lang.Object
lanat.parsing.errors.ErrorFormatter
All Implemented Interfaces:
ErrorLevelProvider
Direct Known Subclasses:
PrettyErrorFormatter, SimpleErrorFormatter
public abstract class ErrorFormatter extends Object implements ErrorLevelProvider
Base class for error formatters. An error formatter defines how an error should be displayed to the user.

To use a custom error formatter, set errorFormatterClass to the class of your custom error formatter. This class will be automatically instantiated and used to generate the error message.

NOTE: the custom error formatter class must always have a constructor that takes a ErrorContext.

An error formatter is instantiated by the ErrorCollector, only one per Command at most, to switch to the next context. Note that it will only be instantiated if there are errors to display.

    • generateTokensView

      @Nullable protected abstract @Nullable textFormatter.TextFormatter generateTokensView(@NotNull @NotNull ParseErrorContext ctx)
      Generates the tokens view for a parse error when the error is a Error.ParseError.

      The tokens view is a view of the tokens that were passed to the parser.

      This method should not be called directly, but rather getGeneratedView().

      Parameters:
      ctx - the current error context, in this case a parse error context
      Returns:
      the TextFormatter representing the tokens view

    • generateInputView

      @Nullable protected abstract @Nullable textFormatter.TextFormatter generateInputView(@NotNull @NotNull TokenizeErrorContext ctx)
      Generates the input view for a tokenize error when the error is a Error.TokenizeError.

      The input view is the raw input string that was passed to the tokenizer.

      This method should not be called directly, but rather getGeneratedView().

      Parameters:
      ctx - the current error context, in this case a tokenize error context
      Returns:
      the TextFormatter representing the input view

      @NotNull public final @NotNull Optional<DisplayInput.Highlight> getHighlightOptions()

    • getGeneratedView

      @NotNull protected final @NotNull textFormatter.TextFormatter getGeneratedView()
      Gets the appropriate generated view for the current error, depending on the type of the current error context.

      This will call either generateTokensView(ParseErrorContext) or generateInputView(TokenizeErrorContext).

      If no view is generated, an empty TextFormatter is returned.
      Returns:
      the generated view.
      See Also:
      • generateTokensView(ParseErrorContext)
      • generateInputView(TokenizeErrorContext)

    • generateInternal

      @NotNull public final @NotNull String generateInternal(@NotNull @NotNull Error<?> error, @NotNull @NotNull ErrorFormattingContext formattingContext)
      Generates the formatted error message for the specified error. This method sets the error level and the formatting context, then calls generate().
      Parameters:
      error - the error
      formattingContext - the formatting context
      Returns:
      the formatted error message
